thread.title: Normal Police Dept. issues warning on jury duty scams
thread.title_full: Normal Police Dept. issues warning on jury duty scams

author: @25newsweek
title: Normal Police Dept. issues warning on jury duty scams
text:
Normal Police Dept. issues warning on jury duty scams
The scam is a phone call saying that you missed a court date and now have an arrest warrant issued against you
NORMAL (
25News Now) - Normal Police are informing residents to watch out for a jury duty scam.
The scam goes like this: A person gets a phone call from someone claiming to be with a personâ€™s local police department. The phone number may even look legitimate.
The caller will say that they missed their jury duty date and because of this, there is now a warrant out for their arrest.
They will then say that all is not lost if they simply pay their fine now. They will ask for this to be done over the phone, using gift cards, Bitcoin, or another payment method.
If this happens, Normal Police recommend hanging up, finding the official number for the local police department or courthouse, and calling them to see if any of the phone call is true.
Normal Police said law enforcement will never call and ask for any type of payment over the phone.
